sentences: Istub sõnatult, nagu oleks suu vett täis (võtnud).
Juhan ei hoidunud teistest kõrvale ega olnud tal vett suus.
Ta jäi vaikselt istuma, nagu tal olnuks suu vett täis.
context: 'Vett' is the partitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'vesi', which means 'water'. In this context, it appears in the idiom expression 'suu vett täis' meaning 'to have one's mouth full of water,' which is used to describe someone who remains completely silent as if unable or unwilling to speak. The word 'vett' indicates a portion or amount of water (partitive case).
